message: Having a web site with no credibility and no compelling answer to "what's in it for me?" does not mean you have a startup. When you don't have to indiscriminately beg for sign-ups, you have a startup.
That said— Exactly what benefits would I get out of trusting you with my email address?

Hey that's fair. Was actually seeing if convore would be a good platform to generate interest. The benefits are faster hotel search through dialogue versus reading lots of reviews, a recommendation engine, and ability to connect with many hotels in a location to get unpublished rates / promotions. Bottom-line is we help users save time and money in their search for hotels.

@josephrooks dude just use a throwaway email address to sign up, i have one that i change every year for things like this.

@Kul, i think your landing page made sense and loooked great, good luck with it.

@kul I'd suggest actually explaining what you guys are doing right off the bat the next time you decide to see if a service is a good way of generating interest. In this case there is no way I would have given you my email address based on your landing page. I'd say this also means your coming soon page is a bit too vague.
Maybe get a better photo with correct depth of field and a bag with lighting that matches, looks pasted on.
@cullenw thanks for the feedback. Makes sense although I've heard other advice of creating a mystery box to capture people's curiosity versus spelling it out.
@danimal thanks for taking a look and offering input. But not sure I fully understand your suggestion.
